intro: Leucosyke celtidifolia, commonly known as the whiteleaf holly, is a shrub native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Cornaceae, which includes willows and snowberries. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale green leaves and clusters of tiny, inconspicuous flowers. Its fruits are small berries that are typically red or yellow when mature. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
